assets.asset: The water flows out of the turbines of the three gorges dam on the Yangtze river.

The inhabitants of Dachang, an historic village, are enjoying their last summer by the Danning river a subsidiary of the Yangtze. A few months later, the village was flooded, and its inhabitants moved away from the river to a new city.
Women practicing Tai-chi in a city park, in front of a big sign indicated the level to be reached by the Yangtze reservoir once the three gorges dam is completed in 2009.
In the streets of Wanzhou a sign points to the level to be reached by the Yangtze reservoir once the dam is completed in 2009.
Residents are stunned by the transformation of their environment as entire areas of their city is being levelled off to prepare for the reservoire rise.
The old city of Fengdu is being torn down ahead of the flooding when the river level will rise to 175 meters above sea level.
The old city of Fengdu, once a tourist attraction is being torn down ahead of the flooding.
Workers consolidating the bank of the Yangtze, before the water level rises.
Workers picking up bricks from the ruins of residential buildings in Fengdu old city.
A worker is taking a break, while others are tearing down houses. The lower part of Wushan is torn down.
The ruins of a commercial street in fengdu old city.
Inhabitants of Gaoyang walking by the razed buildings of the old city.

Inhabitants of Fengdu are loading their belongings onto a truck as they are moving out of the city. Over 1.4 million people have resettled as a result of the dam construction. Many have lost job in the process.
Passengers on a boat to heading to Chongqing. Over 1 million people have left their hometown along the river as their area is to be flooded by the rising water level.
A barge in the mist on the Yangtze.

A man staring at Chongqing skyline from the cable car station. Chongqing is the upstream gate to te reservoir created by the three gorges dam. It is also one of the fastest growing city in China. In spite of its growth it is crippled by unempolyment due to the influx of population who had to leave the three gorges area.

A passer-by in the empty streets of Gaoyang. Positionned by a subsidiary of the Yangtze, the old city was flooded in the summer of 2006. The new city has been rebuilt 30 kilometers away, but economic activity has yet to follow. So far mainly civil servants live here. Businesses are reluctant to settle due to the remote location of the new city.
A shoot the balloon stand by the Yangtze river in Chongqing. Many resettled inhabitants of the three gorges dam had to no choice but to try and make a living on low paid jobs.
A tourist posing for a picture in front of the Three Gorges Dam. The dam has become a tourist attraction and an object of National pride, in spite of the controversy surrounding its construction.
